verses.arabic: الم
verses.english: Alif, Lam, Meem.
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lām-Mīm.

verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ الْكِتَابُ لَا رَيْبَ ۛ فِيهِ ۛ هُدًۭى لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.english: This is the Book about which there is no doubt, a guidance for those conscious of Allah.
verses.transliteration: Ḏālika l-kitābu lā rayba fīhi, hudan lil-muttaqīn.

verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَيُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَاهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
verses.english: Who believe in the unseen, establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them.
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yu'minūna bil-ghaybi wa yuqīmūna aṣ-ṣalata wa mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūn.

verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِمَا أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ وَمَا أُنزِلَ مِن قَبْلِكَ وَبِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
verses.english: And those who believe in what has been revealed to you, and what was revealed before you, and in the Hereafter they are certain.
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna yu’minūna bimā unzila ilayka wa mā unzila min qablika wa bil-ākhirati hum yūqinūn.

verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓـئِكَ عَلَىٰ هُدًۭ مٍّ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ ۖ ۖ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓـئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.english: It is they who are upon guidance from their Lord, and it is they who will be successful.
verses.transliteration: Ūlā'ika ʿalā ḥudāin min rabbihim wa ulā'ika humu l-muf'liḥūn.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنذِرْهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.english: Indeed, those who disbelieve - it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna kafarū sawāon ʿalayhim a-ʾan dhartahum am lam tunḏirhum lā yu'minūn.

verses.arabic: خَتَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ وَعَلَىٰ سَمْعِهِمْ ۖ وَعَلَىٰ أَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ غِشَـٰوَةٌ ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.english: Allah has set a seal on their hearts and on their hearing, and over their eyes is a veil. They will have a great punishment.
verses.transliteration: Khatama allāhu ʿala quloobihim wa ʿala samʿihim wa ʿala absārihim ghishāwatun wa lahum ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun.

verses.arabic: وَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَن يَقُولُ آمَنَّا بِاللَّهِ وَبِالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ ۖ وَمَا هُم بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: And of the people are some who say, 'We believe in Allah and the Last Day,' but they do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Wamina an-nāsi man yaqūlu āmanā billāhi wa bilyawmi l-ākhiri wa mā hum bimum'inin.

verses.arabic: يُخَادِعُونَ اللَّهَ وَالَّذِينَ آمنُوا وَمَا يَخْدَعُونَ إِلَّا أَنفُسَهُمْ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.english: They think they are deceiving Allah, but they are only deceiving themselves, and they do not realize it.
verses.transliteration: Yukhādiʿūna allāha wa alladhīna āmanū wa mā yakhdaʿūna illā anfusahum wa mā yashʿurūn.

verses.arabic: فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ فَزَادَهُمُ اللَّهُ مَرَضًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْذِبُونَ
verses.english: In their hearts is a disease, and Allah increases their disease; they will have a painful punishment for their lies.
verses.transliteration: Fī qulūbihim maraḍun fazādahumu allāhu maraḍan wa lahum ʿadhābun alīmun bimā kānū yakḏibūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا تُفْسِدُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ قَالُوا إِنَّمَا نَحْنُ مُصْلِحُونَ
verses.english: And when it is said to them, 'Do not spread corruption on the earth,' they say, 'We are only reformers.'
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā qīla lahum lā tufsidu fī l-arḍi qālū innamā naḥnu muṣ'liḥūn.

verses.arabic: أَلَا إِنَّهُمْ هُمُ الْمُفْسِدُونَ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.english: Unquestionably, it is they who are the corruptors, but they perceive it not.
verses.transliteration: Alā innahum humu l-muf'sidūn wa lākin lā yashʿurūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ آمِنُّوا كَمَا آمَنَ النَّاسُ ۚ قَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ كَمَا آمَنَ السُّفَهَاءُ ۗ أَلَا إِنَّهُمْ هُمُ السُّفَهَاءُ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: And when it is said to them, 'Believe as the people have believed,' they say, 'Should we believe as the fools have believed?' Unquestionably, it is they who are the fools, but they do not know.
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā qīla lahum āminū kamā āmanan-nāsu qālū anu'minu kamā āmana s-suḥahāʾu, alā innahum humu s-suḥahāʾu wa-lākin lā yaʿlamūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا لَقُوا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا قَالُوا آمَنَّا ۖ وَإِذَا خَلَوْا إِلَىٰ شَيَاطِينِهِمْ قَالُوا إِنَّا مَعَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا نَحْنُ مُسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.english: And when they meet those who believe, they say, We believe; but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, Indeed, we are with you; we were only mockers.
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā laqū alladhīna āmanū qālū āmannā wa-idhā khalaw ilā shayāṭīnihim qālū innā maʿakum innamā naḥnu mustahzi’ūn.

verses.arabic: اللَّهُ يَسْتَهْزِئُ بِهِمْ وَيَمُدُّهُمْ فِي طُغْيَانِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.english: Allah mocks them and prolongs them in their transgression [while] they wander blindly.
verses.transliteration: Allāhu yastahzi’u bihim wa yamudduhum fī ṭugh'yānihim yaʿmahūn.

verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱشْتَرَوُا۟ ٱلضَّلَـٰلَةَ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ ۖ فَمَا رَبِحَت تِّجَـٰرَتُهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُهْتَدِينَ
verses.english: Those are the ones who have purchased error [in exchange] for guidance, so their transaction has brought no profit, nor were they guided.
verses.transliteration: Ūlā’ika alladhīna ishtaraw aḍ-ḍalālata bil-hudā fa-mā rabiḥat tijāratuhum wa mā kānū muhtadīn.

verses.arabic: مَّثَلُهُمْ كَمَثَلِ ٱلَّذِى ٱسْتَوْقَدَ نَارًۭا فَلَمَّآ أَضَآءَتْ مَا حَوْلَهُۥ ذَهَبَ ٱللَّهُ بِنُورِهِمْ وَتَرَكَهُمْ فِى ظُلُمَـٰتٍۢ لَّا يُبْصِرُونَ
verses.english: Their example is that of one who kindled a fire, but when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darkness [so] they could not see.
verses.transliteration: Mathaluhum kamathali alladhī istawqada nāran fa lammā aḍā’at mā ḥawlahu dhahaba allāhu binūrihim wa tarakahum fī ẓulumātin lā yubṣirūn.

verses.arabic: صُمٌّۢ بُكْمٌ عُمْىٌۭ فَهُمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.english: Deaf, dumb and blind – so they will not return [to the right path].
verses.transliteration: Ṣummun bukmun ʿum'yun fa-hum lā yarjiʿūn.

verses.arabic: أَوْ كَصَيِّبٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فِيهِ ظُلُمَـٰتٌۭ وَرَعْدٌۭ وَبَرْقٌۭ ۚ يَجْعَلُونَ أَصَٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِم مِّنَ ٱلصَّوَٰعِقِ حَذَرَ ٱلْمَوْتِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ مُحِيطٌۢ بِٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
verses.english: Or [their deeds] are like a rainstorm from the sky, within which is darkness, thunder, and lightning. They put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps, in dread of death. But Allah is encompassing of the disbelievers.
verses.transliteration: Aw ka-ṣayyibin mina as-samā’i fīhi ẓulumātun wa raʿdun wa barqun yajʿalūna aṣābiʿahum fī ādhānihim mina aṣ-ṣawāʿiqi ḥadhara al-mawt, wallāhu muḥīṭun bil-kāfirīn.

verses.arabic: يَكَادُ ٱلْبَرْقُ يَخْطَفُ أَبْصَـٰرَهُمْ ۖ كُلَّمَآ أَضَآءَ لَهُم مَّشَوْا۟ فِيهِ وَإِذَآ أَظْلَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ قَامُوا۟ ۚ وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَذَهَبَ بِسَمْعِهِمْ وَأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
verses.english: The lightning almost snatches away their sight. Every time it lights [the way] for them, they walk therein; but when darkness covers them, they stand still. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
verses.transliteration: Yakādu al-barqu yakhtaful abṣārahum, kullamā aḍā’a lahum mashaw fīh, wa-idhā aẓlama ʿalayhim qāmū, walaw shā’a allāhu ladhahaba bisamʿihim wa abṣārihim, innallāha ʿalā kulli shay’in qadīr.

verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ رَبَّكُمُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُمْ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
verses.english: O mankind, worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, that you may become righteous.
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā an-nāsu uʿbudū rabbakumu alladhī khalaqakum wa alladhīna min qablikum laʿallakum tattaqūn.

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ فِرَٰشًۭا وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بِنَآءًۭ وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَخْرَجَ بِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ رِزْقًۭا لَّكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تَجْعَلُوا۟ لِلَّهِ أَندَادًۭا وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: He who made for you the earth a bed and the sky a canopy, and sent down from the sky rain and brought forth thereby fruits as provision for you. So do not attribute to Allah equals while you know [that there is nothing similar to Him].
verses.transliteration: Alladhī jaʿala lakumu al-arḍa firāshan wa as-samā’a binā’an wa anzala mina as-samā’i mā’an fa-akhraja bihi mina ath-thamarāti rizqan lakum, fa-lā tajʿalū lillāhi andādan wa antum taʿlamūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِن كُنتُمْ فِى رَيْبٍۢ مِّمَّا نَزَّلْنَا عَلَىٰ عَبْدِنَا فَأْتُوا۟ بِسُورَةٍۢ مِّن مِّثْلِهِۦ وَٱدْعُوا۟ شُهَدَآءَكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
verses.english: And if you are in doubt about what We have sent down upon Our Servant [Muhammad], then produce a surah the like thereof and call upon your witnesses other than Allah, if you should be truthful.
verses.transliteration: Wa in kuntum fī raybin mimmā nazzalnā ʿalā ʿabdinā fa’tū bisūratin min mithlihī wa’dʿū shuhadā’akum min dūni allāhi in kuntum ṣādiqīn.
